placeDesc: This sleepy West Virginia town is home to a amazing group of animal sculptures, created by local artist Ken Sinsel, who creates the scrap metal beasts in his spare time. His yard contains an imposing junkyard sea monster, a metal horse, and a handful of other creations. Sinsel also has other works installed throughout the town nearby.
placeShortDesc: This California artist's front yard acts as a gallery for his unique, scrap metal animal sculptures.
placeNearby: Museum of Ceramics,World's Largest Teapot,Sturgis House Mortuary Museum
placeAddress: 1110 Ridge Avenue,New Cumberland, West Virginia, 26047,United States
placeRelatedPlaces: Fred Smith's Wisconsin Concrete Park,Caballero No. 1,'The DunBear',Valdivia Plum
